alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:01AM PST until January 10 at 9:53PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will rise today and remain above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM PST Tuesday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 16.4 feet late this morning. It will then rise above flood stage late this morning to 17.2 feet late this evening. It will fall below flood stage again early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 12/17/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 415 PM PST.
